Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: http://i.imgur.com/kVxAwL1.png
busy harbor

Baking under the heat of the scorching sun,Lit by the glow of the moon and sporadic hanging lanterns, the harbor abuts the ocean and continues on to the northeast. Ropes, winches, rigging and support beams criss-cross chaotically overhead. Clay buildings stand to the northeast, west and southwest and in the distance to the east, you can see the shoreline fading out of view. Seabirds cry out demanding calls that pierce through the cacophony of sounds from the throngs of merchants, sailors, hawkers and tradespeople that make this harbor a hive of activity.The chaotic buzz of the day's activity has calmed to a murmur, though tradespeople and sailors still occasionally pass through the harbor intent on some business.

Baking under the heat of the scorching sun,Lit by the glow of the moon and sporadic hanging lanterns, the harbor abuts the ocean and continues on to the northeast. The hustle and bustle of merchants, sailors, hawkers and tradespeople make the dock a hive of activity.The chaotic buzz of activity has calmed to a murmur, though tradespeople and sailors still occasionally pass through the dock.

Baking under the heat of the scorching sun,Lit by the glow of the moon and sporadic hanging lanterns, the harbor abuts the ocean and continues on to the northeast. Ropes, winches, rigging and support beams criss-cross chaotically overhead. Clay buildings stand to the northeast, west and southwest and in the distance to the east, you can see the shoreline fading out of view. Seabirds cry out demanding calls that pierce through the cacophony of sounds from the throngs of merchants, sailors, hawkers and tradespeople that make this harbor a hive of activity.The chaotic buzz of the day's activity has calmed to a murmur, though tradespeople and sailors still occasionally pass through the harbor intent on some business.
a long wooden pier leading to a ship
A long wooden pier extends out from the the promenade, leading to a ship docked at the end.
A long wooden pier leading to a ship.
the stone arch to the north
A stone arch to the north leads to a sand dusted cobbled street. Looking northward, you can see:
A stone arch to the north leads to a sand dusted cobbled street. Looking northward, you can see:
the narrow promenade leading to the northeast along the harbor
The promenade narrows as it continues to the northeast along the harbor. Looking northeast, you can see
The promenade narrows as it continues to the northeast along the harbor. Looking northeast, you can see:
the sandy beach to the southeast
To the southeast, the promenade slopes downward until it meets a hard-packed sand. Looking southeast, you can see
To the southeast, the promenade slopes downward until it meets a hard-packed sand. Looking southeast, you can see
stretch of road to the southwest
The promenade slopes gradually downward until it becomes one with the dusty cobbled road leading to the southwest. Looking southwest, you can see:
The promenade slopes gradually downward until it becomes one with the dusty cobbled road leading to the southwest. Looking southwest, you can see:
white sandy shore

A white sandy shore, capaciously spread out. An occasional scattered hunk of driftwood juts from the sand like odd teeth guarding clumps of blue-green seaweed. Here and there multicolored shells peek out from their home embedded in the sand. Further in is a smattering of palms, and coconut trees, varying in size, while low growing red and green ferns shroud the area, keeping its secrets for themselves. Under the piers flood water swivels around the pillars.
A white sandy shore, littered from recent storms.
old workshop

A large open air building where men work even in stormy weather. Various pieces of ship parts are being planed and set here, massive lengths of planking being bowed with heat and heavy stone. A large rolled up canvas lies abandoned on the side of the building.

A large open air building where men work even in stormy weather. Various pieces of ship parts are being planed and set here, massive lengths of planking being bowed with heat and heavy stone. A large rolled up canvas lies abandoned on the side of the building.
the distance

Looking off into the distance, you can see the vast ocean waters stretching to the east, a jumble of adobe clay buildings surrounding the harbor to the west, north and northeast. In the far distance to the southwest, a faint structure gleaming white in the mirage-inducing heat waves of the desert.
sand dune
A drift of sand has piled here, creating a slight obstruction of view, perhaps good to hide behind.
A drift of sand has piled up into an impressive dune.
some flood water
Ankle deep flood water looks dangerous on many levels. The fast moving water has a good change of sweeping your feet from under you and the debris could probably hurt you if it bumps into you.
Ankle deep flood water is flowing on the ground. It's best to avoid the debris.
the sand dusted, clay promenade
A clay promenade with a dusting of white sand from the harbor.
A clay promenade with a dusting of white sand from the harbor.
the scorching heatresidual heat from the day
The heat is sweltering and overwhelming.slowly waning with the cool of night.
some black wrought iron lanterns
Black wrought iron lanterns hang overhead from thick hooks, providing subtle illumination to the area.
Black wrought iron lanterns hang overhead from thick hooks, providing subtle illumination to the area.
the scorching sunluminous moon

Base:Description.midnight: The moon sits high at the apex of the sky, indicating the midnight hour.
Base:Description.aftermidnight: It is after midnight, the moon beginning the slow descent toward the western horizon.
Base:Description.dawn: The sun peeks over the eastern horizon, indicating the arrival of dawn.
Base:Description.morning: The sun climbs higher in the eastern sky as morning progresses toward midday.
Base:Description.midday: The sun sits high at the apex of the sky.
Base:Description.afternoon: The sun begins its descent toward the western horizon.
Base:Description.dusk: The rays of the sun slant low over the land as sunset approaches.
Base:Description.evening: The moon begins climbing up the eastern half of the sky.

Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: the middle of the area
The middle of the area.
The middle of the area.
some wooden piers

Several well constructed piers extend east out over the water from the promenade. Posts drive deep into the water keeping the pier aloft as the waves roll in. Ships of many origins are moored to the piers. Large traders, small dug-outs, slave ships, a couple of warships and others of unknown purpose.
Several well constructed piers extend east out over the water from the promenade.
unmanned vessel

A three master ship, smallish in size but a ship nonetheless. It's bow freshly cured and visibly clean, it is clearly a new vessel. Large white sails rest unmolested, bound high in the rigging. Three demi-culverin are visible above deck.
An unmanned ship, quietly resting in the bay with only a few guards.
crimson ship

A large two masted vessel, with a noticeable compliment of heavy cannons. The bulky crimson ship lurches now and then with passing waves as men load heavy crates and large kegs of powder into the hold.
A large crimson ship, with a noticeable compliment of heavy cannons.
the white sand dusting the edges of the clay promenade
Some fine, white silty sand has crept into the nooks and crannies at the edges of the promenade.
the bluestar-studded sky overhead
The bluestar-studded sky overhead is clear and cloudless.
The bluestar-studded sky overhead is clear and cloudless.
slave ship

Tied to one of the piers rests a dark and foreboding slave ship. Rank after rank of slaves are being herded on board by brutally looking overseers swinging whips. Soft cries and screams escape the slaves as the whips connect with their backs, they stumble up the gang-plank. Several nasty looking guards are overseeing the proceedings, while a small crowd of people stand off to the side staring at the ship with tears running down their cheeks.
A slave ship.
shimmering ocean

A shimmering mass of gleaming azure water, crisp and clear, rolling waves breaking distantly and drawing gently over the shore. In the shallows many exotically colored fish swim and play, darting here and there among the vibrant orange and red coral.In the distance the daunting shadows of larger creatures lurch slowly along, and an occasional tell tale fin breaks the surface as it streaks through the water before disappearing again.

A shimmering mass of rolling azure water, crisp and clear, rolling waves breaking distantly and drawing gently over the shore. In the distance the daunting shadows of larger creatures lurch slowly along, and an occasional tell tale fin breaks the surface as it streaks through the water before disappearing again.

Core:Properties.Core:Property: X[S] \{ \ \{ The cloudless, starlit sky above casts a dim, luminescent glow over the area. \| The air around you is cool in the dim moonglow of midnight. \| The air is still in the dark of night, the luminescent glow of the night sky casting dark shadows all around. \| The stars above twinkle in the dark indigo of the night sky. \} \ \ \{ The rose-gold hue of dawn kisses the eastern horizon. \| The slowly rising sun washes the land in a rosy-golden light. \} \ \ \{ The sun bears down from overhead, oppressively hot and burning. \| The oppressive heat surrounds your body as the scorching sun proceeds through the sky \| The oppressive heat of the day seems to radiate from all around. \| The cloying heat of the day is oppressive and stifling, the sun beating down in shimmering waves. \} \ \ \{ The sun dips lower toward the western horizon as the light shifts to a deeper red hue with the approach of sunset. \| The western sky is painted in strokes of burgundy and gold as dusk slowly approaches. \} \ \}
X[M] EmitIn(\$this, "You catch the muffled sound of the evening bell."); return TRUE;
X[M] EmitIn(\$this, "The deep sound of midday bells is heard from outside."); return TRUE;
X[M] EmitIn(\$this, "Outside, the bells announce midnight."); return TRUE;
X[M] EmitIn(\$this, "The church bells herald the morning."); return TRUE;
